main_definition: To give information about something to someone, usually with the intention of informing or reminding them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Recommendation for a performance review or feedback session after an employee's work period ends
meanings_and_examples.example: At the end of the year, employees will have their performance rec'd by their supervisors.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To call back someone on the phone who has left without saying goodbye
meanings_and_examples.example: I tried to rec my friend after he abruptly hung up during our conversation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A recorded speech or piece of music that is played again, especially for practice purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: She listened to her old high school graduation rec's before the big reunion party.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process of retrieving previously stored data from memory or a database
meanings_and_examples.example: When you press 'recall', it brings back information that was saved in your phone's address book.
